instructions: Heat olive oil in a large pan over medium heat.
Sauté the onion and garlic until softened.
Add the eggplant and cook for about 5 minutes until it starts to soften.
Add the zucchini, bell pepper, and tomatoes, and cook for another 10 minutes.
Stir in the tomato paste, thyme, and basil, and season with salt and pepper.
Cover and simmer for 30 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the vegetables are tender.
Serve hot, garnished with fresh basil if desired.
servingSuggestion: Serve with rice, quinoa, or as a side dish to grilled meats.

instructions: Preheat the oven to 180°C (350°F).
Cook the bacon in a pan until crispy, then remove and set aside.
In the same pan, sauté the onion until softened.
In a bowl, whisk together the eggs, cream, and milk. Season with salt and pepper.
Spread the cooked bacon and onion evenly over the pie crust, then pour the egg mixture over the top.
Sprinkle the grated Gruyère cheese on top.
Bake for 30-35 minutes, until the quiche is golden and set in the center.
Allow to cool for a few minutes before slicing and serving.
servingSuggestion: Serve with a green salad and a glass of white wine.

ingredients: 500g mixed fish fillets (such as cod, bass, or snapper)
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat and sauté the onion, leeks, and garlic until softened.
Add the tomatoes, tomato paste, saffron, thyme, and fennel seeds. Cook for 5 minutes.
Add the fish stock and bring to a boil, then lower the heat and simmer for 20 minutes.
Add the fish fillets and shellfish, and simmer for an additional 10 minutes until the fish is cooked through.
Season with salt and pepper to taste, then serve hot with a side of rouille sauce and crusty bread.
servingSuggestion: Serve with a side of rouille sauce and crusty bread.

instructions: Preheat the oven to 150°C (300°F).
Season the duck legs with salt and pepper, and place them in a roasting dish.
In a saucepan, melt the duck fat with garlic, thyme, and bay leaf.
Pour the melted fat over the duck legs, covering them completely.
Cover the roasting dish with foil and cook in the oven for 2-2.5 hours, until the duck is tender.
Once done, remove the foil and cook for an additional 20 minutes to crisp the skin.
servingSuggestion: Serve with roasted vegetables or potatoes.

instructions: Preheat the grill or oven to 200°C (400°F).
Butter the bread slices on one side.
Place a slice of ham and two slices of Gruyère on the unbuttered side of two slices of bread.
Top with the remaining bread slices
buttered side out.
Spread béchamel sauce over the top slice of bread and sprinkle with more cheese.
Grill or bake the sandwiches for about 10 minutes
until golden and bubbly.
servingSuggestion: Serve with a simple salad or a bowl of soup.

instructions: Melt the butter in a large pot over medium heat.
Add the onions and cook slowly for 30-40 minutes, stirring occasionally, until caramelized.
Add the garlic and cook for 1 minute.
Pour in the wine, scraping the bottom of the pot to release any browned bits.
Add the beef broth, thyme, and bay leaf, and bring to a boil.
Reduce heat and simmer for 30 minutes.
Meanwhile, toast the baguette slices and set aside.
Ladle the soup into bowls, top with toasted bread and grated Gruyère, and place under the broiler until cheese is melted and bubbly.
servingSuggestion: Serve with additional bread or a light salad.

instructions: Preheat the oven to 180°C (350°F).
In a large ovenproof skillet, melt the butter over medium heat and stir in the sugar until dissolved.
Arrange the apple halves in a circular pattern in the skillet and cook for 20 minutes until the apples begin to soften.
Add the lemon juice and salt, and cook for an additional 10 minutes until the apples are caramelized.
Cover the apples with the puff pastry, tucking in the edges.
Bake in the oven for 30 minutes, until the pastry is golden brown.
Allow to cool for 10 minutes before inverting onto a serving plate.
servingSuggestion: Serve with a dollop of whipped cream or vanilla ice cream.

instructions: Preheat the oven to 180°C (350°F) and grease a madeleine pan.
In a bowl, whisk the eggs and sugar until pale and fluffy.
Add the melted butter, flour, baking powder, vanilla extract, lemon zest, and salt, and mix until smooth.
Spoon the batter into the madeleine pan, filling each mold about three-quarters full.
Bake for 10-12 minutes, until golden brown and springy to the touch.
Let the madeleines cool slightly before removing them from the pan.
servingSuggestion: Serve with tea or coffee for an afternoon treat.

instructions: Melt the chocolate in a heatproof bowl over simmering water or in the microwave.
Whisk the eggs and sugar until thick and pale.
In another bowl, whip the cream with a pinch of salt until soft peaks form.
Fold the melted chocolate into the egg mixture, then gently fold in the whipped cream.
Spoon the mousse into serving glasses and refrigerate for at least 2 hours before serving.
servingSuggestion: Serve chilled with whipped cream or fresh berries.

instructions: In a saucepan, heat the milk over medium heat until warm.
Add the chopped chocolate, sugar, vanilla, and salt, and stir until the chocolate is fully melted.
Serve hot, garnished with whipped cream or marshmallows.
servingSuggestion: Enjoy on a cold day with a sweet pastry.

instructions: Preheat the oven to 180°C (350°F).
Place each salmon fillet on a piece of parchment paper.
Top each fillet with lemon slices, garlic, and parsley.
Drizzle with olive oil and season with salt and pepper.
Fold the parchment paper around the salmon to create a sealed packet.
Bake for 15-20 minutes, until the salmon is cooked through.
servingSuggestion: Serve with steamed vegetables or rice.

instructions: In a large pot, cook the sausages until browned, then remove and set aside.
In the same pot, sauté the onion and garlic until softened.
Add the tomato paste, thyme, and bay leaf, then stir in the chicken stock.
Add the duck confit and beans, and simmer for 1 hour.
Add the sausages back to the pot, and cook for an additional 30 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper to taste before serving.
servingSuggestion: Serve with crusty bread and a glass of red wine.

instructions: Preheat the oven to 180°C (350°F).
In a saucepan, heat the cream and garlic until warm.
Butter a baking dish and layer the sliced potatoes, seasoning with salt and pepper.
Pour the warm cream over the potatoes and sprinkle with grated Gruyère.
Cover with foil and bake for 1 hour, then remove the foil and bake for another 20-30 minutes until golden brown.
servingSuggestion: Serve alongside roasted meats or grilled vegetables.

instructions: In a bowl, whisk together the flour, eggs, milk, and butter to form a smooth batter.
Heat a non-stick pan over medium heat and lightly grease it.
Pour a small amount of batter into the pan and swirl to coat the bottom.
Cook for 1-2 minutes on each side, then remove from the pan and set aside.
In the same pan, combine the orange juice, zest, Grand Marnier, and sugar, and cook until heated through.
Place the crepes back in the pan, fold them into quarters, and drizzle with the sauce before serving.
servingSuggestion: Serve immediately, garnished with orange slices or whipped cream.

instructions: Mix the salt, sugar, and peppercorns together.
Rub the mixture evenly over the salmon fillet.
Wrap the salmon tightly in plastic wrap and refrigerate for 48 hours.
Before serving, sprinkle with fresh dill and slice thinly.
servingSuggestion: Serve with rye bread and mustard sauce.
